brand.tone:
Tone characteristics:

Plainspoken, no jargon

Trust-led and experienced

Local and grounded

Commercially credible

Reassuring for domestic customers

Avoid salesy language, fluff, or “marketing talk”.
brand.writingStyle:
Writing Style Rules

Use short paragraphs and clear headings

Write in UK English

Speak directly to the reader (“you”, “your site”, “your property”)

Focus on problems → solutions → outcomes

Prioritise clarity over creativity

Include subtle CTAs (request a quote, arrange a site visit, call us)

Avoid over-promising or guarantees

business.targetAudience:
Target Audience

Primary (Commercial focus):

Property managers

Facilities managers

Business parks & industrial estates

Schools, colleges & education sites

Councils & public sector

Developers & construction firms

Landowners & estate managers

Secondary (Domestic support):

Homeowners with large gardens

Domestic tree work & clearance

One-off or ongoing maintenance
painPoints: Grounds and trees becoming unsafe or unmanaged
Struggling to find reliable contractors who turn up
Needing work completed safely, professionally, and on schedule
Overgrown or neglected commercial sites affecting appearance
Compliance and safety concerns (trees, access, visibility)
Needing ongoing maintenance rather than one-off jobs
desiredActions: Arrange a one-off or contract job

globalContext:
DB Tree & Garden Services is a North East–based grounds maintenance and tree surgery business with a strong focus on commercial and large-scale work. The company works with businesses, landowners, and organisations across Sunderland and the wider North East, providing reliable, professional, and safety-focused services.

The website and blog content should position the business as:

Experienced and dependable

Commercially capable

Locally trusted

Easy to deal with

Suitable for both contract and one-off work

Blog content should support:

Local SEO

Service authority

Trust and credibility

Enquiry generation (not just traffic)

styling.referenceHtml:
Example Blog Title Using DB Styling

This is an example intro paragraph. Use it to set context, mention the service + location naturally, and clearly state the benefit to the reader in plain language.

Example Section Heading

This is a short section paragraph. Keep sentences clear and practical. Explain what you do, why it matters, and what outcome the reader gets.

Quick takeaway: Use this callout to highlight the key point, benefit, or “what clients care about most”.

Example List Section

  • Point one: short benefit-led line.
  • Point two: short benefit-led line.
  • Point three: short benefit-led line.

Ready to Get a Quote?

Add one short CTA paragraph here. Keep it direct: what they get + what to do next.

Request a Free Quote
